doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Smart peripheral creates memory initialisation for a MIPS32 based Linux kernel boot. Performs the generation of boot code at the reset vector (virtual address 0xbfc00000) of the MIPS32 processor. Loads both the linux kernel and initial ramdisk into memory and patches the boot code to jump to the kernel start. Initialises the MIPS32 registers and Linux command line.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: MIPS Malta User Manual. MIPS Boot code reference.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This is a master port to access the memory in the system for initalisation of initrd and writing boot code to the reset vector

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This is a slave port that provides the boardId for Malta (default 0x420)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This must specify the name of the Linux kernel that is being loaded. This must be consistent with the imagefile loaded and specified by the imagefile attribute on the processor.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Optionally specific the flattened device tree blob file specifying the development board details for the Linux kernel to read.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The hex address in virtual memory that contains the command line. Default 0x80002000.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specify a compressed initial ram disk file file for loading.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specify the root filesystem for booting. This is a string of the form '/dev/hda1'.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Allows the boardID to be configured. Defaults to 0x420 for Malta with CoreLV.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The decimal size of the available memory. For Example 128MBytes is 134217728.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This attribute allows an additional kernal command(s) to be added.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This attribute allows a non linux program to be loaded onto the Malta platform. The program elf should be passed as though it was the kernel file.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This attribute is used to pass a new boot image for the non:volatile memory that contains the reset vector from which the procesor starts execution.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Set the system endian, "big" or "little"; used for writing boot code. Default is "little" endian.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This attribute is used to indicate that the peripheral is being used to configure the Android Goldfish platform.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This attribute is used to control the writing of a file of the boot code containing the reset vector from which the procesor starts execution.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This attribute is used to set the address at which the the code should be 'fixed' to add the setup required for booting a linux kernel a0 = number of kernel arguments a1 = command table start a2 = command line arguments start a3 = size fo physical ram

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable the generation of boot code.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable this peripheral. Only provides the boardId in this case.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specify the PCI slot.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specify the PCI function number.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specify the number of bits to be used when aligning the initrd data (should match page size configured into kernel). default=12.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Locate the initial ramdisk in top of memory. By default the ramdisk is located in the next page after the top of the kernel image.
